conclusion: The difference in displacement between the two objects is not necessarily continuously increasing.
The graph shows that object A starts with a higher velocity than object B and maintains this lead throughout the time interval from 0 to t1.
The difference in displacement is determined by the area between the two curves, not just the difference in their velocities.
If the area between the curves decreases at any point during the time interval, then the difference in displacement would not be continuously increasing.
